TITLE I--FAMILY ASSISTANCE PROVISIONS

SEC. 101. EXTENSION OF THE TEMPORARY ASSISTANCE FOR NEEDY FAMILIES BLOCK GRANT PROGRAM THROUGH MARCH 31, 2004. Activities authorized by part A of title IV of the Social Security Act, and by sections 510, 1108(b), and 1925 of such Act, shall continue through March 31, 2004, in the manner authorized for fiscal year 2002. Grants and payments may be made for carrying out such activities during the first two quarters of fiscal year 2004 at the level provided for the first two quarters of fiscal year 2002. Amendments are made to section 403(a)(3)(H) of the Social Security Act for supplemental grants for population increases in certain states. Amendments are made to various sections of the Social Security Act, including changes to grant funding timelines and maintenance of effort requirements. These changes extend activities authorized under part A of title IV through March 31, 2004, and adjust funding levels for fiscal years 2002 and 2004. SEC. 102 extends the National Random Sample Study of Child Welfare and Child Welfare Waiver Authority through March 31, 2004, with necessary appropriations. SEC. 201 amends the Internal Revenue Code to disclose return information for income contingent repayment of student loans until December 31, 2004. SEC. 202 extends the Internal Revenue Service user fees until December 31, 2004 for requests made after September 30, 2003. The Secretary will establish a program for user fees on requests to the IRS for ruling letters, opinion letters, and determination letters. Fees will vary based on categories, be determined by request complexity, and must be paid in advance. Exemptions and reduced fees will be provided as deemed appropriate, with an exemption for certain pension plan determination letter requests. Additionally, certain sections from previous Acts are repealed, and fees collected must be approved by an appropriations Act. The amendments apply to requests made after the enactment of the Act. SEC. 301 of TITLE III extends COBRA fees from September 30, 2003, to March 31, 2004. Extension of Sunset for Medicare Cost-Sharing described in the Social Security Act is amended to end in March 2004. The total amount available for allocation for fiscal years 2002 and 2003 is adjusted. A special rule for the first quarter of 2004 is added to the Social Security Act. In 2004, a special rule was added to the Social Security Act for the first quarter, allocating $100,000,000 for assistance to qualifying individuals. SEC. 402 extends the provision equalizing urban and rural standardized Medicare inpatient hospital payments. The amendment in the Miscellaneous Appropriations Act, 2003 changes the deadline from September 30, 2003 to March 31, 2004. The effective date of the amendments can be delayed by the Secretary of Health and Human Services until November 1, 2003 if implementation is not feasible. The Secretary may delay implementation of the amendments until November 1, 2003. If implementation is delayed, adjustments will be made for fiscal year 2004 to ensure total payments remain the same. These adjustments will not affect payment rates for subsequent periods after September 30, 2004. The enactment of the paragraph will not impact payment rates for services after September 30, 2004. The Secretary has the authority to implement the provisions without the need for rulemaking or notice, and there is no opportunity for administrative or judicial review of any delays or determinations made.
